alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 16 at 6:26PM MST until August 16 at 7:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR YAVAPAI COUNTY NEAR HORSESHOE RESERVOIR... At 624 PM MST, Rain has ended across the area, but flooding is expected to continue across the warned area. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sunset Mountain, Horseshoe Reservoir and Chalk Mountain. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Lime Creek, Professor Creek, Verde River, Tangle Creek, Ash Spring Creek and Little Lime Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
